Items.Title: Roll Call
Invocation
Items.AgendaNote:
Delivered by: Aisha Al Adawiya, Women in Islam, Inc. P.O. Box 814, Lincolnton Station, New York, N.Y. 10037. 

Motion to spread the invocation in full upon the record by the Council Member Dickens.
Items.MinutesNote:
The Invocation was delivered by:  Aisha AlAdawiya, Women in Islam, Inc. P.O. Box 814, Lincollnton, New York, N.Y. 10037.

Council Member Dickens moved to spread the Invocation in full upon the Record.

Items.Title: Adoption of Minutes
Items.AgendaNote: Motion that the Minutes of the Stated Meeting April 29, 2014 be adopted as printed by Council Member Johnson.
Items.MinutesNote: Council Member Johnson moved that the Minutes of the Stated Meeting of April 29, 2014 be adopted as printed.

Items.Title: Messages & Papers from the Mayor
Communication from the Mayor  -  “AN ACT to amend the vehicle and traffic law, in relation to speed limits”.  A.9731

Items.MatterName: Amend the vehicle and traffic law, in relation to speed limits ( A.9731)

Items.Title: Communication from the Mayor - “AN ACT to amend chapter 746 of the laws of 1988 amending the vehicle and traffic law, the general municipal law and the public officers law relating to the civil liability of vehicle owners for traffic control signal violations, in relation to extending the effectiveness thereof; and to amend local law number 46 of the city of New York for the year 1989 amending the administrative code of the city of New York relating to civil liability of  vehicle owners for traffic control signal violations, in relation to extending the effectiveness thereof”.  A.9834 / S.7703
Items.ActionText: This Mayor's Message was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on State and Federal Legislation
Items.MatterName: Relating to civil liability of  vehicle owners for traffic control signal violations, in relation to extending the effectiveness thereof. (A.9834 / S.7703)

Items.Title: Communications from City, County & Borough Offices
Petitions and Communications
Land Use Call-Ups

By the Chair of the Land Use Committee Council Member Greenfield:
Pursuant to Rule 11.20c of the Council and Section 197-d (b)(3) of the New York City Charter, the Council hereby resolves that the action of the City Planning Commission on Uniform Land Use Review Procedure Application no. C 140277 ZSK shall be subject to Council review.  This item is related to Application no. C 140278 HAK which is subject to Council review pursuant to Section 197-d of the New York City Charter and Article 16 of the General Municipal Law.
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Land Use Call-Up be Approved, by Council approved by Roll Call.
Items.MatterName: Planning, 768-770 Decatur St. a.k.a. 1696-1712 Broadway, Brooklyn (C 140277 ZSK & C 140278 HAK)

Items.MatterName: Approving the new designation and changes in the designation of certain organizations to receive funding in the Expense Budget.

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the New York State Legislature to pass and the Governor to sign into law A.2448 and S.4142,  which would allow sixteen and seventeen year olds to be appointed to New York City Community Boards.
Items.AgendaNote: Adopted by the Committee on Governmental Operations
Items.MinutesNote:
Pursuant to Rule 8.50 of the Council, the Public Advocate (Ms. James) called for a voice vote.  Hearing those in favor, the Public Advocate (Ms. James) declared the Resolution to be adopted.



The following 3 Council Members formally voted against this item: 

Council Members Koslowitz, Ulrich and Vallone.



Adopted by the Council by voice-vote.
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Resolution be Approved, by Council approved by voice vote.
Items.MatterName: Allow 16 and 17 year olds to be appointed to NYC Community Boards. (A.2448/S.4142)

Items.Title: Resolution recognizing every June as Gun Violence Awareness Month in New York City.
Items.AgendaNote: Adopted by the Committee on Public Safety
Items.MinutesNote:
Pursuant to Rule 8.50 of the Council, the Public Advocate (Ms. James) called for a voice vote.  Hearing no objections, the Public Advocate (Ms. James) declared the Resolution to be adopted.


Adopted unanimously by the Council by voice-vote.
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Resolution be Approved, by Council approved by voice vote.
Items.MatterName: Recognizing every June as Gun Violence Awareness Month in NYC.

Items.Title: Report of the Committee on State and Federal Legislation
Communication from the Mayor  -  “AN ACT to amend the vehicle and traffic law, in relation to speed limits”.  A.9731
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Mayor's Message be Approved, by Council approved by Roll Call.
Items.MatterName: Amend the vehicle and traffic law, in relation to speed limits ( A.9731)

Items.Title: Communication from the Mayor - “AN ACT to amend chapter 746 of the laws of 1988 amending the vehicle and traffic law, the general municipal law and the public officers law relating to the civil liability of vehicle owners for traffic control signal violations, in relation to extending the effectiveness thereof; and to amend local law number 46 of the city of New York for the year 1989 amending the administrative code of the city of New York relating to civil liability of  vehicle owners for traffic control signal violations, in relation to extending the effectiveness thereof”.  A.9834 / S.7703
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Mayor's Message be Approved, by Council approved by Roll Call.
Items.MatterName: Relating to civil liability of  vehicle owners for traffic control signal violations, in relation to extending the effectiveness thereof. (A.9834 / S.7703)

Items.Title: State Legislation Resolution requesting the New York State Legislature to pass bills introduced by Senator Espaillat, S.6115, and Assembly Member Rosa, A.8386, “AN ACT to amend the vehicle and traffic law and the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation  to  traffic-control  indications for cities of one million or more; to amend chapter 746 of the laws of 1988  amending  the vehicle and traffic law, the general municipal law and the public officers law, relating to the civil liability of  vehicle  owners  for  traffic  control  signal  violations, in relation to making such provisions permanent; and to amend local law number 46  of the  city  of  New  York for the year 1989 amending the administrative code of New York relating to civil liability  of  vehicle  owners  for traffic   control  signal  violations,  in  relation  to  making  such provisions permanent; and repealing certain provisions of the  vehicle and  traffic  law  and the administrative code of the city of New York relating thereto”.
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this SLR be Approved, by Council approved by Roll Call.
Items.MatterName: Amend the vehicle and traffic law and the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to traffic control indications for cities of one million or more. (S.6115/A.8386)

Items.Title: State Legislation Resolution requesting the New York State Legislature to pass bills introduced by Senator Golden, S.7009, and Assembly Member Abbate, A.9573, “AN ACT to amend the general municipal law, in relation to training of fire officers in cities of one million or more”.
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this SLR be Approved, by Council approved by consent Roll Call.
Items.MatterName: Training  of fire officers in cities of one million or more. (S.7009/A.9573)

INTRODUCTION AND READING OF BILLS
A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to the right of senior citizens residing in multiple dwellings to maintain pets.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Housing and Buildings
Items.MatterName: Right of senior citizens residing in multiple dwellings to maintain pets.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the New York city charter, in relation to internet voting in certain municipal elections.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Governmental Operations
Items.MatterName: Internet voting in certain municipal elections.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to requiring the cleaning of liquid on a sidewalk, flagging or curbstone generated by trash placed curbside for collection and allowing the use of a hose to conduct such cleaning during times otherwise proscribed by such code.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Sanitation and Solid Waste Management
Items.MatterName: Requiring the cleaning of liquid on a sidewalk, flagging or curbstone generated by trash placed curbside for collection.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to authorizing the painting of curb cuts.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Transportation
Items.MatterName: Authorizing the painting of curb cuts.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to reducing greenhouse gases by eighty percent by two thousand fifty.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Environmental Protection
Items.MatterName: Reducing greenhouse gases by 80% by 2050.

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the New York State legislature to pass and the Governor to enact S.6490/A.8344, regarding the repeal of reimbursement tax credits to low-wage employers who pay minimum wages to students ages 16 to 19.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Civil Service and Labor
Items.MatterName: Repeal of reimbursement tax credits to low-wage employers who pay minimum wages to students ages 16 to 19. (S.6490/A.8344)

Items.Title: Resolution calling on the New York State Legislature to pass and the Governor to sign, legislation to amend the Domestic Relations Law and the Family Court Act to prevent the Division of Child Support Enforcement from suspending driving privileges for individuals who need a functioning New York State driver’s license in order to earn a living.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on General Welfare
Items.MatterName: Amend the Domestic Relations Law and the Family Court Act to prevent the Division of Child Support Enforcement from suspending driving privileges for individuals who need a functioning NYS driver’s license in order to earn a living.

Items.Title: Resolution approving the new designation and changes in the designation of certain organizations to receive funding in the Expense Budget.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Finance
Items.MatterName: Approving the new designation and changes in the designation of certain organizations to receive funding in the Expense Budget.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to permitting interested parties to receive notification of items published in the City Record.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Governmental Operations
Items.MatterName: Permitting interested parties to receive notification of items published in the City Record.

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the United State Congress to introduce and pass, and President Barack Obama to sign, legislation to expand the Earned Income Tax Credit, and further, calling upon the New York State Legislature to introduce and pass, and the Governor to sign, legislation which would enable the City of New York to increase the City's Earned Income Tax Credit from 5% to 10% of the federal Earned Income Tax Credit.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Finance
Items.MatterName: Increase the City's Earned Income Tax Credit from 5% to 10% of the federal Earned Income Tax Credit.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to placing greater regulations and restraints on the creation of driveway curb cuts, and providing local community board notification.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Transportation
Items.MatterName: Placing greater regulations and restraints on the creation of driveway curb cuts, and providing local community board notification.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend to administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to permissible standing at fire hydrants.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Transportation
Items.MatterName: Permissible standing at fire hydrants.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to “rounding up” parking time.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Transportation
Items.MatterName: "Rounding up” parking time.

Items.MatterName: NYS Wage Board to recommend, and the Commissioner of Labor and the Governor to establish a living wage rate of $15 for large fast food restaurant employees.

Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Housing and Buildings

Items.Title: Resolution calling on the Legislature and the Governor to restore funding to the Brownfields Opportunity Areas (BOA) Program, find a long-term funding source for the Program, and allow projects built consistent with a BOA to access the state’s Tangible Property Brownfield Tax Credits and also receive a 5 percent tax credit bonus.

Items.MinutesNote: At this point the Speaker (Council Member Mark-Viverito) made the following annoucements:
Whereupon on motion of the Speaker (Council Member Mark-Viverito), the Public Advocate (Ms. James) recessed the Meeting subject to call.
The presence of a quorum was announced by The Public Advocate (Ms. James)
At this point, the Public Advocate (Ms. James) declared that the aforementioned items were adopted and referred to the Committee on Land Use and to the appropriate Land Use Subcommittee.

Items.Title: Communication from the Mayor – Submitting the name of Meenakshi Srinivasan to the City Council for its advice and consent regarding her appointment as a member of the Landmarks Preservation Commission, pursuant to Sections 31 and 3020 of the New York city charter.

Items.MinutesNote: The Public Advocate (Ms. James) put the question whether the Council would agree with and adopt such motion which was decided in the affirmative by the following vote:

The following files were removed from the General Order Calendar and voted separately:



M-70 (Home Rule item), 46-4-0 (CMs Matteo, Ulrich, Williams and Ignizio)
M-71 (Home Rule item), 47-3-0 (CMs Matteo, Ulrich and Ignizio)
SLR No. 1 (Home Rule item), 47-3-0 (CMs Matteo, Ulrich and Ignizio)

LU 81 & Res No. 290, 49-0-1 (Abstention: CM Williams)

See files for individual votes.
The Public Advocate (Ms. James) put the question whether the Council would agree with and adopt such motion which was decided in the affirmative by the following vote:

Items.Title: Passed The Consent Agenda
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that these files be approved by consent vote.

Items.MinutesNote: This Stated Meeting of June 11, 2014 was recessed and subsequently re-opened on June 18, 2014.  The June 18, 2014 Recessed Meeting is considered a continuation of the June 11, 2014 Stated Meeting.  Council Member Palma, though not present at this Meeting held on June 11, 2014, was marked Present for the Recessed Meeting held on June 18, 2013, and is thereby considered to be Present but Not Voting for this Stated Meeting held on June 11, 2014.
